meanings.definition: A dry, rough protective crust that forms over a wound during healing.
meanings.sent1: After I fell and scraped my knee, scabs formed to protect the cut.
meanings.sent2: The scabs on his elbow were a sign that the injury was healing.
meanings.sent3: The scabs on the wound looked like tiny shields guarding the skin.
meanings.sent4: Her scabs were like nature's bandages, keeping the wound safe.
meanings.sent5: The scabs were a reminder of the body's amazing ability to repair itself.

meanings.definition: A person who refuses to join a labor union or go on strike, often working in place of those on strike.
meanings.sent1: During the strike, the company hired scabs to keep the business running.
meanings.sent2: The scabs crossed the picket line to work while the others protested.
meanings.sent3: The scabs were seen as traitors by the striking workers.
meanings.sent4: The scabs were willing to take the jobs the others had left vacant.
meanings.sent5: The scabs were controversial figures in the labor dispute.

meanings.sent1: The wound will scab over as it starts to heal.
meanings.sent2: If you pick at it, the cut will take longer to scab.
meanings.sent3: I watched the scrape scab up over the next few days.
meanings.sent4: The injury began to scab, indicating the start of the healing process.
meanings.sent5: It's important to let the wound scab naturally to avoid infection.
